articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: Oldest wooden tools unearthed in East Asia show that ancient humans made planned trips to dig up edible plants - Live Science
articles.description: The 300,000 year-old tools show that hominins in East Asia made planned foraging trips to lakeshores and designed instruments for specific purposes.
articles.content: Archaeologists have discovered 35 wooden tools from the Old Stone Age in China which they say show impressive craftsmanship, advanced cognitive skills and offer new insights into what ancient humans … [+3767 chars]
